meanings.definition: A type of shrimp commonly used in Spanish cuisine.
meanings.sent1: The chef prepared a delicious paella with fresh carabineros.
meanings.sent2: The seafood restaurant served grilled carabineros with garlic butter.
meanings.sent3: The carabineros in the dish were so plump and juicy, they seemed to dance on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The carabineros added a burst of color to the paella, like little red jewels.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the carabineros cooking filled the kitchen with a mouth-watering scent.

meanings.definition: A type of military or police force in some Spanish-speaking countries.
meanings.sent1: The carabineros patrolled the streets to ensure safety in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The carabineros wore distinctive uniforms that set them apart from other officers.
meanings.sent3: The carabineros stopped to help an elderly lady cross the busy street, earning smiles from passersby.
meanings.sent4: The carabineros stood like statues at the entrance, guarding the government building with unwavering dedication.
meanings.sent5: The presence of the carabineros in the town square made everyone feel protected and secure.
